column4: which file should I modified so the following module is loaded every time I reboot?
sudo modprobe coretemp
I mean the coretemp kernel module
add "coretemp" to /etc/modules
thanks
wikipedia tells you
do you have "localhost" in mydestination?
and also, root should get any mails, they should be redirected to a common user account
so check you procmail settings
and also, root should get any mails, they should be redirected to a common user account. check your /etc/aliases
thanks. /etc/aliases says:
look for lines starting with root:
do you have procmail installed?
yes
/etc/procmailrc  is the config
I see, ubuntu doesn't provide a sample file, the syntax seems complicated I will check it maybe I need to configure it so I get mail from root
add "root:  yourusername" to /etc/aliases and run "newaliases" as root then. "postfix reload"
thank will try it now. I checked and mail to my username arrives correctly to localhost
so you are missing the root alias
thanks. it is working perfectly now after adding the alias. So ubuntu/postfix doesn't allow any direct mail to root? as security measure?
yes, in general root should never read mails. they always should be forwarded to a common useraccount. its a security thing
postfix should have asked you at installation about this
